python-version.description: The Python version to use when running tox.

tox-label-create-changes.description: The tox label (passed using the `-m` argument) to run before creating the commit. Two environment variables will be set: `VERSION` and `PR_BODY_OUTPUT_PATH`. After running tox, all file changes shown in `git status` will be included in the commit.

checkout-branch.description: The name of the branch to initially checkout.

branch-name.description: The name of the branch to create. If a `version` input is passed to the workflow, it can be referenced as `$VERSION`.

commit-title.description: The one-line commit message to use.

pr-base.description: The name of the branch to merge to in the PR. This appears as the 'base' in the GitHub UI.

pr-title.description: The title of the PR. If a `version` input is passed to the workflow, it can be referenced as `$VERSION`.

pr-body.description: The body of the PR. If a `version` input is passed to the workflow, it can be referenced as `$VERSION`.

pr-body-input-format.description: The format of the PR body fragment generated by the tox label that prepares releases. The value must exactly match the `--from` argument values that pandoc supports, but currently only 'gfm' and 'rst' are allowed.
